eu.fbk.dkm.springles.backend

Class AbstractRepositoryBackend

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.fbk.dkm.springles.backend.AbstractRepositoryBackend
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Backend

    public abstract class AbstractRepositoryBackend
extends Object
implements Backend
    Abstract backend implementation wrapping a Repository instance.

    This class provides a base implementation of the Backend interface that wraps an underlying Repository instance and provides access to its data through RepositoryTransactions. Concrete classes must implement method initializeRepository(File) that is called at initialization time and returns the repository object being wrapped. Thread safety is realized through mutually exclusive synchronization of methods accessing the wrapped repository. Note that no check is performed to ensure that invocation of API methods conforms to the prescribed lifecycle: if required, such a check can be obtained by wrapping the backend with Backends.debuggingBackend(Backend, Logger).

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public final void initialize(@Nullable
              File dataDir)
                      throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        Initializes the backend. This method is called to initialize the backend, supplying the data directory where the backend can store its data. The method acquires the wrapped repository object by calling initializeRepository(File), then initializes the repository and caches its writable and ValueFactory properties.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface Backend
        Parameters:
        dataDir - an optional data directory where the backend can persist its RDF data
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException - on failure

      • initializeRepository

        protected abstract org.openrdf.repository.Repository initializeRepository(@Nullable
                                                     File dataDir)
                                                                   throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        Acquires and initializes the wrapped repository, based on the supplied optional data directory. This method is called by initialize(File) and must return a the wrapped repository instance, non-initialized.
        Parameters:
        dataDir - the data directory, possibly null for transient backends
        Returns:
        a non-initialized repository instance
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException - on failure

      • getRepository

        protected final org.openrdf.repository.Repository getRepository()
        Provides access to the wrapped repository object. This method can be called only after initialization of the backend.
        Returns:
        the wrapped repository object

      • isWritable

        public boolean isWritable()
        Specifies whether the backend supports write access (delete / add statements). This method is called only after the backend is initialized, as the writable status may depend on the data directory supplied at initialization time. Returns the writable status of the wrapped repository, as returned by Repository.isWritable().
        Specified by:
        isWritable in interface Backend
        Returns:
        true if the backend supports write access

      • getValueFactory

        public org.openrdf.model.ValueFactory getValueFactory()
        Returns the ValueFactory associated to the backend. This method is called only after the backend is initialized. Returns the ValueFactory associated to the wrapped repository.
        Specified by:
        getValueFactory in interface Backend
        Returns:
        the ValueFactory associated to the backend

      • newTransaction

        public Transaction newTransaction(String id,
                         boolean writable)
                           throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        Creates a new transaction manipulating data in the backend. The returned transaction is not expected to support inference (InferenceMode parameters and closure-related operations are ignored) as well as named queries and update operations (methods Transaction.query(URI, QueryType, InferenceMode, Object...) and Transaction.update(URI, InferenceMode, Object...) are unsupported). Creates a RepositoryTransaction, backed by a RepositoryConnection to the wrapped repository. In case a Bigdata repository is wrapped, the method opens a suitable read-only or read/write repository Bigdata connection, based on the supplied writable parameter.
        Specified by:
        newTransaction in interface Backend
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the created transaction
        writable - true if the transaction must support read/write access
        Returns:
        the created transaction
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException - on failure, including the case a read/write transaction is requested but the backend is read-only

      • close

        public void close()
           throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        Closes the backend. This method is called to close the backend and release the associated resources. For some Backend implementations, properly closing the backend is mandatory in order to avoid data losses (see specific implementation details). Closes the wrapped repository.
        Specified by:
        close in interface Backend
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException - on failure

      • getBigdataConnection

        private static org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryConnection getBigdataConnection(org.openrdf.repository.Repository repository,
                                                               boolean writable)
                                                                         throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        Helper method that opens the appropriate Bigdata repository connection based on the specified writable parameter.
        Parameters:
        repository - the Bigdata repository
        writable - the desired writable status for the connection
        Returns:
        the opened connection, on success
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException - on failure
